name: Novelkeys Cream Clicky
description: So long as Novelkeys keeps making new and interesting Cream family switches, I will continue to review them. But rather than subtle changes for the Cream Clickies, they’ve gone with an entirely new design never before seen in the MX footprint. This is definitely a switch you’re going to want to see.

name: Cookies n’ Cream
description: What’s this? Two tactile switch reviews back to back?? I think this one surely was worth it though, given that it’s kicking off the start of the new DK Creamery family of switches. In this one I take a look at the unique cross section of tactility that the new Cookies n’ Cream switches occupy.

name: Cherry MX ‘New Nixie’
description: The official name for this switch that it is being sold under is that of the ‘MX Black Clear-Tops’. While I often strive to be technical and accurate in all of my reviews, I know that ‘Nixies’ or ‘New Nixies’ will be the moniker these adopt amongst the community. Thus I will be referring to them as such throughout this review.

name: JWICK Semi Silent
description: After having sat and thought about these switches for some time, I don’t think I gave them the real credit that they deserve. Here’s my new, much more nuanced take on the JWICK Semi Silent switches and their unique silencing mechanism.

name: EMT V2
description: Look, I know you probably think this is me getting in touch with my weeb side because EMT switches are named after Emilia from Re:Zero, but lets be real here: I just like the color of the switches and their fancy LED diffusers. Check out how they actually preform, though, by clicking here.

name: Huano Fi Switch
description: Dyesub keyboard switches? In the fanciest packaging I’ve ever seen?? While this may not be the next switch you’ll use in building a keyboard, the Huano Fi switches are definitely ones you’ll want to see at least once. (And there’s a ton of photos in this review…)

name: KTT Purple Sauce Switch
description: Who would have ever guessed that the secret ingredient in KTT’s new secret sauce was purple. Here we take a deep dive into what exactly this Purple Sauce is and why its so damn clicky.

name: Huano Pineapple
description: While this would be a really good place to work in some sort of summer-y, fruit related introduction, I’m still just trying to figure out how these switches were named ‘Pineapples’. Of all of the orange fruits I can think of, which is very few for the record, pineapples were not one that came to mind. I guess I’m going to have to find a way around this mental block to actually review the damn things…

name: LICHICX Lucy
description: Is there even enough proof of life yet that LICHICX is its own factory? I’m not entirely sure I care. So long as they keep putting out switches as interesting as these Lucy silent linears, they can be whatever they want for all I care…

name: Gateron UHMknown
description: With all the upgrades to tooling and manufacturing, it was only a matter of time until Gateron got around to their UHMWPE stems. With brand new molds designed just for these UHMknown switches, how will they stack up to Gateron’s other recent offerings?

name: Gateron Root Beer Float
description: I knew I would finally get around to it - a review of a PuNkShoO switch, and what better one than the latest and greatest. Here we take a look at not only the Gateron Root Beer Floats, but briefly stop by all of the switches he’s released leading up to these.

name: NK Silk Mictlán
description: I know that I’m a bit late on this one in more than one way, but better late then never right? This review takes a look at not just the new GMK Mictlan inspired NK Silk switches, but the performance of the ‘Batch 2’ Silks with improved factory lubrication.

name: Momoka Shark Switch
description: You know I’m sitting here writing this splash introduction and realized I didn’t make a single Jaws reference in this entire switch review. Consider this your one ‘bigger boat’ reference as you’re definitely going to need it to fit these tactile bumps into your boards…

name: Wuque Studio Morandi
description: A Wuque Studios switch with all-POM housings made by Haimu feels like this? I don’t even want to spoil this one in the splash text as these switches are just that hard to believe.

name: Lubed Black Geon
description: With an impressive resume of keyboards built up thus far, GeonWorks has stepped into the custom switch world with their new Black and Clear switches. Do these stack up as a good option to parallel their other releases, or do they simply fall short?

name: Invokeys Blueberry Chiffon
description: Well, they’re back with yet another switch that just leaves me hungry when I think about it. Invokeys’ sophomore switch debut is here in the form of Blueberry Chiffon switches, and being a light weight tactile they really take on a challenge living up to the Matcha Latte hype. But will they fall short…?
